alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 4:40PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Garfield and northeastern Kane Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 439 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, or 41 miles southeast of Capitol Reef National Park, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ticaboo and Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Lake Powell. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes Utah Route 276 between mile markers 26 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Glen Canyon Recreation Area, Lake Powell; South Central Utah; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands
